meanings.definition: To participate in a series of activities meant to achieve a particular result, especially in a political or military context.
meanings.sent1: She campaigned tirelessly for her election, going door-to-door to talk to voters.
meanings.sent2: The candidate campaigned in various cities to gather support for the upcoming election.
meanings.sent3: The penguin campaigned for the title of 'Best Dressed' in the annual zoo fashion show.
meanings.sent4: The flowers campaigned for attention, standing tall and colorful in the garden.
meanings.sent5: The students campaigned for a longer lunch break by collecting signatures for a petition.

meanings.definition: To work in an organized and active way towards a goal or objective.
meanings.sent1: The team campaigned to raise funds for the local animal shelter through a bake sale.
meanings.sent2: She campaigned diligently to improve her grades by studying every day after school.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel campaigned to gather the most nuts before winter arrived.
meanings.sent4: The waves campaigned against the shore, trying to erode the sandy beach.
meanings.sent5: The ants campaigned together to carry a large piece of food back to their nest.
